intro: Syngonanthus duidae var. longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved duidae, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. Due to its unique foliage and floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
